title: It’s a shame in the name of a hotel
text:
Guys, if you have ever known staying in a decently clean place, then please please SIMPLY AVOID STAYING HERE!!!
It was so pathetic that it is literally a shame that owners of such properties blatantly sell their rooms calling themselves a hotel. It is worst than some Dharamshala.
The rooms have aged beyond their legitimate life and the interiors could be suitable for shooting some Ramsay Bandhu horror movies! Beds were creaky, unclean, probably the bedsheets weren’t washed and in fact one of the mattress had missing springs so it just plopped in when we sat on it.
The bathroom has no window or ventilation, stinks like hell, water faucets leaking and dripping and the bathroom floor was sticky and slippery in most areas except right under the shower where it was probably most frequently used.
In the freezing January winter of Shimla, the hotel had the audacity to charge us extra Rs. 250 for a room heater, which were also “jugaad” since one out of two coils was missing, so no real heating!
They advertise that they are close to Mall Road, but they are a good half an hour uphill walk to the Mall Road, and it is a distance for which you get no taxis or public transportation. 
All in all, an extremely poor hotel, with staff that was blatantly indifferent towards how bad a property they were running. Please avoid!

title: Money-Minded Hotel with Zero Concern for Customer Safety
text:
Money-Minded Hotel with Zero Concern for Customer Safety

I strongly advise travelers to avoid this hotel at all costs. This is one of the most money-minded establishments I have ever come across, with the worst cancellation and refund policy you can imagine.

Due to heavy landslides and washed-out roads, my flights and train journeys were canceled. On top of that, the government itself issued advisories asking people to avoid non-essential travel to Shimla, Kinnaur, and Spiti regions. Naturally, I had no choice but to cancel my 15-day Spiti Valley circuit trip — no sensible person would risk their life in such dangerous conditions.

Out of the 8 hotels I had booked, every single one promptly refunded my booking without hesitation, understanding the seriousness of the situation — except this hotel. Instead of showing empathy or even basic customer understanding, they only offered to change my booking dates within 10 days, completely ignoring the fact that trains, flights, and road routes were shut. How exactly do they expect someone from Bangalore to magically show up in Shimla within two weeks under such conditions?

This hotel refused to refund a single rupee. Their rigid, money-first approach clearly shows that customer safety and satisfaction mean nothing to them.

title: Nice place for stay in Shimla
text:
Hotel Surya is an old property and has about 12 floors. It has a new wing and an old wing with the restaurant nested between the two. One lift is there for the old wing for floors 1 to 8 and another one for the new wing. you exit one lift, cross the dining area and then enter the other lift. As soon as you exit the victory tunnel, you can see the board of the hotel so reaching it is very easy. They have parking at the hotel but it is limited and at the time of rush, you have to plan properly. 

Reception area is small but well laid out and clean. It has a small sitting area also with newspapers of the day available for reading. you have to take stairs to reach the reception area from parking/road. 

Rooms are adequate size and bathrooms are large. The hotel provides the toiletries along with clean towels. Hot water is available always and the room has a tv with cable connection. Bed is ok and there is a small seating area with two sofa chairs. Each room has a good size cupboard and ample tables to keep for luggage, items etc. Best thing is that the hotel provides you room slippers. 

In the new wing, you have a passage  which leads to the mall road. But you have to climb some 30 odd stairs to reach the road. So you can visit mall road as many number of times you want by foot saving lot of time. If you are health conscious, you can go for an early morning stroll or jog as well.  I used to go to mall road for morning walk, then to office for work and then for softy ice-cream after dinner. Watching the stars and the lit hills late in the night while licking your softy at the ridge is a memorable experience. 

The hotel provides breakfast but the spread is limited and fixed. However, the dining area is spacious, with nice view of the valley below. Food is good and we had nice dinner during our stay. You should try mushroom dishes if you are in hills. 

Service is top class. very friendly and prompt. you have intercom for dialing reception and room service. Service has an old world charm to it as some of the staff i guess have been there for number of years. 

The hotel has a wi-fi but it is not very reliable so always have a back up just in case. the room has ample number of power sockets so you will not be left wanting if you have number of devices to charge. 

Try to book get one of the bigger VIP rooms which are kind of suite rooms. They have some special room for newly weds also. I enjoyed my stay as my work was on mall road and i used to just walk and reach my place in 15-20 mins. As you go towards the mall road, a small detour of 5 mins takes you to the famous kalibari temple of Shimla. The temple offers breathtaking views of Shimla and surroundings. 

I will definitely recommend people to experience the hotel at least once.

title: Filthy dirty standard rooms
text:
I booked for a couple of days stay in this hotel..was initially impressed by the nice reviews and the pictures posted..And went ahead to book a standard room via cleartrip..
Very first thing about the hotel is its location.although mentioned that its on the mall road..its actually on the circular road and is far from the mall road.well theres a shortcut through a narrow dark lane by the gutter side that takes you up to one extreme end of the mall road..it might be a horrifying experience if you risk to take the same shortcut after evening.
then comes the standard room..curtains.bed sheet.pillows.towel..everythings stained and dirty..with windows that will open towards the garbage dumping area.looked at all the rooms.and all of them has the pungent smell of pee and the dampness of an isolated construction..
Finally we decided in an hour to upgrade to a deluxe room..well for a change the room had a nice view of the valley..and theres some renovation done with some good wood work that has probably taken away the smell and dampness..the bathrooms were standard with no geyser and no toiletries..
Next comes to the food which was average and nothing worth mentioning except the stained cutleries and teapots.
Coming to the management..they seemed very friendly and on request told us that they will book cabs for us for the sightseeing tour..later we booked the same tour with local drivers on the mall road at less than half the price..finally when we paid the room charges we had to pay the full price and not the discounted price thats available on various hotel booking websites..and that also in the off season..
A couple of advice for the readers
1)you will get rooms of far better quality in the mall road(actual mall road i mean) at a pretty low price
2)dont get swayed by the pictures..u will waste your money
3)even if you are still booking a room in the hotel do book a deluxe room and not a standard room
Pros: the place where the management sits is pretty nice and have got a good view.there is a lift available in the hotel..these are the only two good things in this hotel..well then how does it matter when you end up in filthy dirty rooms for staying

title: Great location, good views
text:
Main reasons why we chose Landmark
1) It had its own car parking. We were arriving by self-drive car and hence needed one
2) Its 6th floor opens onto mall road making it convenient to walk there

The rooms were clean and decently sized. All the rooms have one window from where you can see the valley. On the first night, we'd a room that was facing the mall road. Exhausted from travelling and a day full of sightseeing, we were looking forward to an early night. Unfortunately, there was a severe monkey menace late into the night with a group of monkeys screaming, fighting right outside the window over the hotel's shed. We called the reception multiple times and they attempted to shoo them away. There are no guarantees and these kinds of things happen here was the response from the hotel. Fortunately for us, the last shooing did work and we were able to sleep around 12:00. The next day we were shifted to a full valley facing room and that does not have this issue. We did speak to the manager as well. He assured that this is not a regular feature but they're aware of the problem. They are looking at measures to curb it but have no permission to put up nets or shades. So if booking, would highly recommend that you avoid these sets of rooms. 

The location is perfect as it is a driveable hotel that also opens up right onto mall road ( a few minutes walk). The breakfast was okayish. Quality could be improved.  

Would recommend this if you need car parking and need to be close to the mall road. If you're not arriving in your own car, then there are many other options more reasonably priced and with similar or better proximity to mall road.

title: Good hotel at a good location with respect to Mall & Ridge
text:
First of all, keep this in mind that hotels in Shimla are costly. Rooms claimed to be super delux by a hotel is actually just a good room. During peak season if tariff of a room is anything above Rs 2000, you can assume that it will be a good room. But nothing great. Rooms under Rs 1500 (if any) can be the ones at the backside of the hotel and a bit suffocating. Also remember if you are staying at Mall or above ridge, then cars can charge additional Rs 200-300 to pick you up from hotel (that is only if car is allowed in front of your hotel).

Hotel Shiwalik Regency is located a bit higher than the Christ Church (and Ridge). To reach this hotel from Ridge, you need to walk uphill for 10min, while coming down to Ridge is obviously faster and easier. The location is quite peaceful near the jakhu road. Jakhu will be few minutes from this hotel by car. Overall stay in the hotel was pleasant. The staff is courteous and the managers are helpful. Room was clean with a nice attached bathroom (with a bathtub). We took a super delux room and hence the room was on the front side with a balcony giving a view of the valley. Though the room could have been a bit larger, but it is actually just ok for 2 people. The view might not be great, but it's not bad either. Try to take a room on the top most two floors to get a better view of the valley. Monkeys may sometimes pass through your balcony, but that's a common phenomenon in Shimla. Food is served at the room. The food is good and not costly. If you book car from this hotel, you may get a bit discount from the market price. 

Reaching the hotel from bus stand / taxi stand / station can be a bit tedious if you decide to walk. A car will take Rs 350 to drop you at the hotel from station.

Govt employees should try to book Hotel Grand. It is wonderfully located at Kali Temple Rd. Its so near from The Mall and Ridge, but yet so peacefully located. Though I don't know how the facilities are there.

Hotel staff was also courteous including the restaurant staff. We hired taxi to visit Jakhoo temple, Kufri instead of driving by own and which I think was the wisest decision we made. Lot of parking issues in Shimla & also risky driving so local sight-seeing is preferred via TAXI instead of own car. A full day taxi for local sight-seeing including Jakhoo, Kufri charged 1700 rs. 

Overall recommend this hotel for family, couples and all sorts of travelers.

title: looks are not everything
text: Had a back room it was quiet but there are no doors to the outside leading to the market so anyone can walk in from the back of the hotel, as you can see from the damage to the bedroom door. The hotel in November was SO cold in the dining room.... again no doors so everyone sat with coats on and some even hoods up, no heating in there either, they take a lot of coach and school parties. You can see the mountains from the dining room, did not find any lounge area.If bedroom on top floor lift only goes half way up and you have to walk up the stairs. Staff were pleasant and did try, but bed and breakfast not really worth the money, breakfast toast and jam sandwich/very occasionally a egg, no fruit, but did have Indian meat meal if you fancied it. Evening meal same menu each day. On my last day 20/11/2015 they did issue electric fires for the bedroom, shower and toilet good. Plus side... it was very near to market street and town but if you are infirm, it is difficult as many steep steps to get there. If hotel not been paid for I would have moved out, expensive for what you got. Taxi's outside for trips, hotel ones safer as they know guides, but more expensive. 3 days long enough to stay in Shimla, unless you want to make longer journey's from there. Clarks Hotel  worth a visit, very up market and expensive to stay but nice to have a cup of tea and  a very reasonable price, cheaper than some places. Lots of monkey's  everywhere. Enjoyed the toy train to get there, fantastic views, and it stops for comfort stops and to get food and drinks, takes approx 5 hrs. on a hard seat.

title: Interesting stay for 2 days but could have been better
text:
We booked this hotel online. Visited in Nov 2015. Baljees Residency is neighbour to it, Interesting hotel. Has 2 wings if i may elaborate. A front buliding with 8 floors topped by a roof top restaurant, and a 4 storied building above it in the back which has a passage leading to the upper mall road. The rooms have been renovated i guess. I believe they allot the back building for those booked online, Front rooms are for the ones walking in. So check on it. We got the back building but we did not grumble as the rooms had good views. 

The back door leads to a passage which leads to a steep staircase that leads to the mall road. The Shimla kalibari is in walking distance from it uphill. Breakfast had limited choice but was ok. Service was good. Food was good too. We had dinner on both days. Very good terrace restaurant with wonderful view. Lock your windows as monkeys are frequent visitors here and there. Wifi was more or less ok but who but that was not so much significant to us. Our room also had a ceiling mirror which was odd.

Car parking available, has an SBI ATM opposite to the main entrance. For people being allotted the back building you need to go up to the 8th floor to the terrace restaurant and then take the alleyway for another lift or staircase to the building. We found it quite interesting. Overall, nice experience. But if you book online check out if being given fresh rooms in the front building.
